title: Johnnie Johnson (cricketer)
text: Frank Sidney Roland "Johnnie" Johnson (4 August 1917 – 10 May 2009) was an English <a href="cricket">cricket</a>er and senior <a href="Royal%20Air%20Force">Royal Air Force</a> officer. He played <a href="first-class%20cricket">first-class cricket</a> for several teams between 1941 and 1947. Johnson joined the RAF in 1935 and despite transferring to the <a href="British%20Indian%20Army">British Indian Army</a> for the early part of <a href="World%20War%20II">World War II</a>, he spent 38 years in the RAF and left with the rank of <a href="Air-Vice%20Marshal">Air-Vice Marshal</a>.
